Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Immunocytochemical techniques were used to examine alterations in the expression of neuronal nitric oxide synthase ( NOS ) in bladder pathways following acute and chronic irritation of the urinary tract of the rat .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| urinary tract irritation (acute and chronic) |

In this paragraph, the terms "acute and chronic irritation of the urinary tract of the rat" describe a disease state or condition. The specific type of disease isn't mentioned, but "irritation" implies some sort of inflammation or infection. The terms "acute" and "chronic" suggest that this condition can be either short-term or long-term.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Disease |
| --- |
| urinary tract irritation (acute and chronic) |

In this paragraph, the only entity that clearly refers to a disease or health condition is "urinary tract irritation (acute and chronic)". The other entities, such as "immunocytochemical techniques", "examination", "expression of neuronal nitric oxide synthase (NOS)", and "bladder pathways", are methods or processes used to study the disease.

Please identify the "Chemical" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Chemical". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Immunocytochemical techniques were used to examine alterations in the expression of neuronal nitric oxide synthase ( NOS ) in bladder pathways following acute and chronic irritation of the urinary tract of the rat .

Let's think step by step.

| Chemical |
| --- |
| neuronal nitric oxide synthase ( NOS ) |
| nitric oxide |

Explanation:
The paragraph mentions "neuronal nitric oxide synthase ( NOS )" as the specific type of enzyme that is being examined for alterations in expression. Nitric oxide is the product of this enzyme. Therefore, both "neuronal nitric oxide synthase ( NOS )" and "nitric oxide" are valid chemical entities in this context.
